intro: Taraxacum eriobasis, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the dandelion family (Compositae). It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and a yellow flower head that develops into a fluffy seed head. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant produces numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds, aiding in its spread. It is often considered a weed in agricultural and garden settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
